Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in upholding the RPD's credibility findings
Decision_Level: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Credibility_Assessment: RPD found lack of detail in descriptions of speeches; RAD upheld, but court found assessment unreasonable
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness, intelligibility, justification based on evidence
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Sufficiency of detail in applicant's account of political speeches
Application_Error: RAD applied inappropriate deference to unreasonable RPD credibility finding
Evidence_Ignored: Details provided by applicant in transcript regarding speeches
Application_Factor: Consistency and plausibility of narrative under cross-examination
Decision_Outcome: Initial refusal, upheld on appeal, overturned on judicial review
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credible detail in political persecution narrative
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient weight given to applicant's detailed testimony
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to provide intelligible and justified credibility assessment
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent or insufficient detail in describing events
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of RAD decision
Procedural_Issue: Improper application of deference by RAD
Omission_Type: Failure to acknowledge relevant evidence in transcript
